infotexts.PauseMenuQuitVerification: Are you sure you want to quit the game? All your unsaved progress will be lost.
infotexts.PauseMenuRetryVerification: Are you sure you want to stop the mission and load the previous save file? All your unsaved progress will be lost.
infotexts.ServerPortToolTip: The port used to communicate with clients. If clients fail to connect to your server, you may need to enable UPnP port forwarding on forward the port manually.
infotexts.ServerQueryPortToolTip: The port used to communicate with Steam's server browser and respond to info pings from clients. If clients don't see your server in the server list or if authenticating their Steam ID fails, you may need to enable UPnP port forwarding on forward the port manually.
infotexts.PublicServerToolTip: Public servers are shown in the list of available servers in the "Join Server" -tab.
infotexts.AttemptUPnPToolTip: UPnP can be used for forwarding ports on your router to allow players join the server. However, UPnP isn't supported by all routers, so you may need to setup port forwards manually if players are unable to join the server (see the readme for instructions).
infotexts.NoSubscribedMods: You haven't subscribed to any mods on the Steam Workshop. Click the "Find more mods" button below to get started!
infotexts.WorkshopItemCreateHelpText: You can use this tab to publish new items in the Steam Workshop. You can either select an existing submarine or a content package from the "Your items" menu at the left, or create an entirely new item by clicking the "Create a new item" button.
infotexts.WorkshopItemCorePackageTooltip: Core packages are special content packages that contain all the core files (executables, configuration files) the game won't run without. There must always be one (and only one) core package selected. Only select this if you wish to create a mod that replaces all the Vanilla files. Mods that only add things to the Vanilla game (or another core package) should not be marked as core packages.
infotexts.WorkshopItemChangenoteTooltip: You're publishing an update for an existing Workshop item. You can use the change note to explain what's new in the update.
infotexts.WorkshopItemDeleteTooltip: Deletes the item from Steam Workshop.
infotexts.WorkshopItemDeleteVerification: Are you sure you want to delete the item "[itemname]" from the Steam Workshop?
infotexts.WorkshopItemPublishTooltip: Uploads the files to the Steam Workshop.
infotexts.WorkshopItemFileIncluded: File will be included in the Workshop item.
infotexts.WorkshopItemFileNotIncluded: File is not present in the Workshop item folder and will not be included in the Workshop item. This may be desirable if you want the mod to use Vanilla files that the players already have - otherwise you should copy the file to the Workshop item folder.
infotexts.WorkshopItemIllegalPath: Workshop items are only allowed to modify files in the Mod folder or add submarine files to the Submarines folder. Please create a separate subfolder for the files.
infotexts.WorkshopItemRefreshFileListTooltip: Reload the configuration file of the workshop item (metadata.xml inside the item's folder) and add all new files in it to the file list.
infotexts.WorkshopItemPublished: "[itemname]" is now available in the Steam Workshop!
infotexts.WorkshopItemPublishFailed: Publishing "[itemname]" in the Steam Workshop failed.
infotexts.WorkshopItemPreviewImageDialogTitle: Select the preview image for the Steam Workshop item.
infotexts.WorkshopItemPreviewImageTooLarge: The file size of the preview image has to be less than 1 MB.
infotexts.WorkshopErrorInstallRequiredToEdit: Cannot edit the workshop item "[itemname]" because it has not been installed.
infotexts.WorkshopErrorInstallRequiredToEnable: Cannot enable the workshop item "[itemname]" because it has not been installed.
infotexts.WorkshopErrorOverwriteOnEnable: Cannot enable workshop item "[itemname]". The file "[filename]" would be overwritten by the item.
infotexts.WorkshopErrorIllegalPathOnEnable: Could not install the file "[filename]". Workshop items are only allowed to modify files in the Mod folder or add submarine files to the Submarines folder.
infotexts.WorkshopItemIncompatibleTooltip: This Workshop item is not compatible with your version of Barotrauma.
infotexts.LightMapScaleToolTip: Lower values improve performance, but cause shadows to appear more pixellated.
infotexts.SpecularLightingToolTip: Enables specular lighting, an effect which creates brighter spots of light on shiny objects.
infotexts.ChromaticAberrationToolTip: Enables a subtle color distortion effect at the edges of the screen.
infotexts.CorePackageRequiredWarning: You cannot deselect the content package because it's a core package required for the game to work. You may switch it by selecting another core package.
infotexts.IncorrectExe: The executable you've launched is not present in the content package [selectedpackage]. Do you want to launch [exename]?
infotexts.ApplySettingsQuestion: Do you want to apply the settings or discard the changes?
infotexts.RestartRequiredResolution: You need to restart the game for the resolution changes to take effect.
infotexts.RestartRequiredLanguage: You need to restart the game for the language change to take effect.
infotexts.IncompatibleContentPackage: Content package "[packagename]" is not compatible with this version of Barotrauma. The package was made for the version [packageversion], your game version is [gameversion].
infotexts.IncompatibleContentPackageUnknownVersion: Content package "[packagename]" is not compatible with this version of Barotrauma. The package was made for an unknown version, your game version is [gameversion].
infotexts.ContentPackageMissingCoreFiles: Content package "[packagename]" is marked as a core package but does not contain all the required files for a core package. Missing content file types: [missingfiletypes]
infotexts.ContentPackageCantMakeCorePackage: Content package "[packagename]" cannot be marked as a core package because it does not contain all the required files for a core package. Missing content file types: [missingfiletypes]
infotexts.ServerSettingsMinRespawnToolTip: What percentage of players has to be dead/spectating until a respawn shuttle is dispatched.
infotexts.ServerSettingsRespawnDurationToolTip: The amount of time respawned players have to navigate the respawn shuttle to the main submarine. After the duration expires, the shuttle will automatically head back out of the level.
infotexts.ServerSettingsUseTraitorRatio: Use % of players for max traitors
infotexts.RoundSummaryGameOver: The ocean has claimed [sub] and its crew.
infotexts.Head: Head
infotexts.Name: Name
infotexts.DeleteDialogQuestion: Are you sure you want to delete "[file]"?
infotexts.SteamDllNotFound: Initializing Steam client failed (steam_api64.dll not found). All Steam features have been disabled - you will not be able to use the Steam Workshop or join servers that use Steam.
infotexts.SteamClientInitFailed: Initializing Steam client failed. Please make sure Steam is running and you are logged in to an account. All Steam features have been disabled - you will not be able to use the Steam Workshop or join servers that use Steam.
infotexts.SaveNameInUseText: Please choose another name for the save file
infotexts.ShuttleWarning: Most shuttles are not adequately equipped to deal with the dangers of the Europan depths. Are you sure you want to choose a shuttle as your vessel?
infotexts.ContentPackageMismatchWarning: The submarine may not be compatible with the currently selected content packages, because it requires the content packages [requiredcontentpackages]. Are you sure you want to choose the submarine?
infotexts.FireWarningText: Are you sure you want to fire [charactername] from your crew? You will not be able to hire the character again.
infotexts.LeaveSubBehind: One of your vessels isn't at the exit yet. Do you want to leave it behind?
infotexts.LeaveSubsBehind: Some of your vessels aren't at the exit yet. Do you want to leave them behind?
infotexts.ServerListUnknownVersion: Could not determine compatibility (unknown game version)
infotexts.ServerListNoSteamQueryResponse: Could not determine compatibility with the server because it did not respond to queries. This may happen if the server is down or if the host has not forwarded their query port, but you may still attempt to connect to the server.
infotexts.ServerListUnknownContentPackage: Could not determine compatibility (unknown content package)
infotexts.ServerListIncompatibleVersion: This server is not compatible with your version of Barotrauma [version] required).
infotexts.ServerListIncompatibleContentPackage: Content package "[contentpackage]" (MD5: [hash]) required to play on this server.
infotexts.ServerListContentPackageNotEnabled: You need to enable the content package in the game's settings "[contentpackage]" to play on this server.
infotexts.ServerListIncompatibleContentPackageWork: Content package "[contentpackage]" required to play on this server. You can install the package from the Steam Workshop.
infotexts.ServerListSubscribeMissingPackagesToolti: Subscribe to the missing content packages in the Steam Workshop and open the Workshop menu where you can download and enable them.
The missing content packages are available in the Steam Workshop, but Steam features are not available if you don't own Barotrauma on Steam.
infotexts.ServerListNoSteamConnection: Could not find any servers (not connected to Steam).
infotexts.MasterServerTimeOutError: Could not connect to master server (request timed out).
infotexts.MasterServerErrorException: Error while connecting to master server { [error] }
infotexts.MasterServerError404: Error while connecting to master server (404 - [masterserverurl] not found)
infotexts.MasterServerErrorUnavailable: Error while connecting to master server (505 - Service Unavailable). The master server may be down for maintenance or temporarily overloaded. Please try again after in a few moments.
infotexts.MasterServerErrorDefault: Error while connecting to master server ([statuscode]: [statusdescription])
infotexts.CouldNotConnectToServer: Could not connect to the server.
infotexts.InvalidIPAddress: Failed to resolve address "[serverip]:[port]". Please make sure you have entered a valid IP address.
infotexts.ConnectionLostReconnecting: You have been disconnected from the server. Reconnecting...
infotexts.ServerFullQuestionPrompt: Do you want to wait join the server queue and wait for a slot to free up?
infotexts.WaitingInServerQueue: Waiting for a slot to free up on the server.
infotexts.DisconnectReason.Banned: You have been banned from the server.
infotexts.DisconnectReason.Kicked: You have been kicked from the server.
infotexts.DisconnectReason.AuthenticationRequired: Client did not properly request authentication.
infotexts.DisconnectReason.SteamAuthenticationRequ: Steam authentication required. Please make sure Steam is running and you are logged in to an account.
infotexts.DisconnectReason.SessionTaken: Your session was taken by a new connection on the same IP address.
infotexts.DisconnectReason.NotOnWhitelist: You are not on the server's whitelist.
infotexts.DisconnectMessage.AFK: You have been away from keyboard for too long.
infotexts.DisconnectMessage.SteamAuthNoLongerValid: Steam authentication is no longer valid ([status]).
infotexts.DisconnectMessage.InvalidVersion: Version "[version]" required to connect to the server (Your version: "[clientversion]")
infotexts.DisconnectMessage.MissingContentPackage: You need the content package [missingcontentpackage] to play on the server.
infotexts.DisconnectMessage.MissingContentPackages: You need the content packages [missingcontentpackages] to play on the server.
infotexts.DisconnectMessage.IncompatibleContentPac: You must disable the content package [incompatiblecontentpackage] before joining.
You must disable the content packages [incompatiblecontentpackages] before joining.
infotexts.SubNotFound: Submarine not found in your submarine folder
infotexts.SubDoesntMatch: Your version of the submarine doesn't match the servers version
infotexts.SubNotFoundError: Submarine [subname] was selected by the server. Matching file not found in your submarine folder.
infotexts.SubLoadError: Could not load submarine [subname]. The file may be corrupted.
infotexts.SubDoesntMatchError:
Your version of the submarine file [subname] does not match the server's version!
Your MD5 hash: [myhash]
Server's MD5 hash: [serverhash]
infotexts.DownloadSubQuestion: Do you want to download the file from the server host?
infotexts.WaitForFileTransfers: Waiting for file transfers to finish before starting the round...
infotexts.ServerInitFailedAddressAlreadyInUse: [errormsg]. Are you trying to run multiple servers on the same port?
infotexts.PermissionsRemoved: The host has removed all your special permissions.
infotexts.RoundRunningSpectateDisabled: A round is already running and the admin has disabled spectating. You will have to wait for a new round to start.
infotexts.RoundRunningSpectateEnabled: A round is already running, but you can spectate the game while waiting for a respawn shuttle or a new round.
infotexts.NewCampaignCharacterText: Creating a new character will discard your previous character, and you will lose all your skill progress and all the items in your possession. Do you wish to create a new character?
infotexts.InsufficientSkills: Your skills may be insufficient to use the item! [requiredskill] level [requiredlevel] required.
infotexts.AddSubToolTip: Places another submarine into the current submarine file. Can be used for adding things such as smaller vessels, escape pods or detachable sections into the main submarine.
infotexts.HoldToLink: Hold space and click with the mouse to link to another item.
infotexts.CharacterModeToolTip: Allows you to pick up and use items. Useful for things such as placing items inside closets, turning devices on/off and doing the wiring.
infotexts.WiringModeToolTip: Allows you to connect wires between items.
infotexts.GenerateWaypointsToolTip: AI controlled crew members require waypoints to navigate around the sub.
infotexts.SubNameMissingWarning: Name your submarine before saving it.
infotexts.ItemAssemblyNameMissingWarning: Name your item assembly before saving it.
infotexts.ItemAssemblyFileExistsWarning: There's already an item assembly with the same name. Do you want to replace the existing assembly?
infotexts.NoHullsWarning: No hulls found in the submarine. Hulls determine the "borders" of an individual room and are required for water and air distribution to work correctly.
infotexts.DisconnectedVentsWarning: The submarine contains vents which haven't been linked to an oxygen generator. Select a vent and click an oxygen generator while holding space to link them.
infotexts.DisconnectedTurretsWarning: The submarine contains [itemname]s which haven't been linked to an ammunition loader. Select the item and click a loader while holding space to link them.
infotexts.NoWaypointsWarning: No waypoints found in the submarine. AI controlled crew members won't be able to navigate without waypoints.
infotexts.NoCargoSpawnpointWarning: "The submarine does not have spawnpoints for cargo (which are used for determining where to place bought items). To fix this, create a new spawnpoint and change its "spawn type" parameter to "cargo".
infotexts.FarAwayEntitiesWarning: One or more structures/items have been placed very far from the submarine. Do you want to move the camera to them?
infotexts.AdjustLightsPrompt: This submarine was saved using an older version of Barotrauma, which used a different formula to calculate lighting. The lighting in the submarine may now appear too bright. Do you want to automatically readjust the lighting for the new lighting formula?
infotexts.AdjustedLightsNotification: The brightness of the lights has been adjusted. Areas with multiple light sources may still appear too bright and require reducing the range or brightness of the lights manually. You may also use the console command "multiplylights" to adjust the brightness of all the lights as once. For example, "multiplylights 1,1,1,0.5" would decrease the brightness by 50%.
infotexts.NoBallastTagsWarning: You should add the tag "ballast" to the ballast pumps to allow AI characters to identify which pumps are used for controlling the buoyancy of the submarine.
infotexts.NoHullNamesWarning: No names given to any of the hulls, using autogenerated names. Characters use the names to refer to different rooms when reporting things such as hull breaches.
infotexts.DeletingContainerWithItems:
A container with items inside was deleted, delete contained items as well?

Contained items:
infotexts.EntityDescription.hull: Hulls determine which parts are considered to be "inside the sub". Generally every room should be enclosed by a hull.
infotexts.EntityDescription.gap: Gaps allow water and air to flow between two hulls.
infotexts.EntityDescription.waypoint: Used by AI characters to navigate inside the submarine.
infotexts.EntityDescription.spawnpoint: Determines which rooms the crew spawns inside.
infotexts.EntityDescription.ff_x_wall: A large horizontal wall with collision detection
infotexts.EntityDescription.ff_x_wall_cables: A large vertical wall with collision detection
infotexts.EntityDescription.ff_y_wall: A large vertical wall with collision detection
infotexts.EntityDescription.inwalll90cables: A large vertical wall with collision detection
infotexts.EntityDescription.largehorizontalback: A decorative structure with no collision detection
infotexts.EntityDescription.smallhorizontalback: A decorative structure with no collision detection
infotexts.EntityDescription.largeverticalback: A decorative structure with no collision detection
infotexts.EntityDescription.largeverticalback2: A decorative structure with no collision detection
infotexts.EntityDescription.smallverticalback: A decorative structure with no collision detection
infotexts.EntityDescription.smallverticalback2: A decorative structure with no collision detection
infotexts.LevelEditorLevelObjNameEmpty: Please enter a name for the level object.
infotexts.LevelEditorLevelObjNameTaken: The selected name is already in use.
infotexts.LevelEditorLevelObjTextureNotFound: Could not find the selected texture file.
infotexts.CharacterEditor.CantAddJointsNoLimbEleme: Cannot add joints, because no limb elements were found!
infotexts.CharacterEditor.HumanoidLimbDeletionDisa: Deleting limbs from a humanoid is currently disabled due to crashing
infotexts.CharacterEditor.CopyJointSettingsTooltip: Copies the currently tweaked settings to all selected joints.
infotexts.CharacterEditor.ProvideFileName: Please provide a name for the file
infotexts.CharacterEditor.RecreateRagdollTooltip: Many of the parameters requires recreation of the ragdoll. If adjusting the parameter doesn't seem to have effect, click this button.
infotexts.CharacterEditor.SelectTargetLimbForJoint: Left click to select the target limb for the other end of the joint.
infotexts.CharacterEditor.HoldLeftAltToAdjustCycle: Hold Left Alt to adjust cycle speed
infotexts.CharacterEditor.Head: Head
infotexts.CharacterEditor.HoldLeftAltToManipulateJ: Hold Left Alt to manipulate the other end of the joint
infotexts.CharacterEditor.TextureDoesNotExist: The texture file does not exist!
infotexts.CharacterEditor.MultipleTorsosDefined: You need to define one and only one limb as Torso!
infotexts.CharacterEditor.FailedToReadHTML: Character Editor Screen: Failed to read HTML at [path]
infotexts.CharacterEditor.MultipleItemsWithSameHie: Multiple items with the same hierarchy [hierarchy] found ([name]). Cannot continue.
infotexts.Submarine.Description.Humpback: A former military vessel, WH4-L3 "Humpback" has been outfitted to withstand most of the dangers in deep Europa. Her relatively high velocity is offset by low maneuverability. Still boasting an older model reactor, power needs to be supplemented by a backup battery array or the crew will find themselves unable to run all of the new equipment.
infotexts.Submarine.Description.Bunyip: Latest in the line of personnel transports, Bunyip is capable of ferrying crew between submarines and installations. Its operating radius is considerably lower than its more advanced cousins and no weapons on board make it vulnerable to attacks.
infotexts.Submarine.Description.Muikku: The workhorse of the colonies, these little shuttles have good speed and dive/ascent characteristics, but they are fragile and their low capacity batteries limit their range somewhat.
infotexts.Submarine.Description.Orca: With a relatively high top speed and fantastic ascent and descent characteristics due to her 3 large ballast tanks, Orca class subs are agile vessels, let down only by their small compliment of weapons, unreliable engine and reactors with a greater than average hunger for fuel.
infotexts.Submarine.Description.Typhon: Typhon class subs are known for their brutish appearance, reasonable array of light and heavy firepower, and their general dependability. Any captain should be aware of their poor rate of descent and unimpressive top speed.
infotexts.LinkWaypoint: Hold space to link to another waypoint
infotexts.IDCardDescriptionTooltip: Characters spawning at this spawnpoint will have the specified description added to their ID card. This can be used to describe additional access levels their card has on the sub.
infotexts.IDCardTagsTooltip: Characters spawning at this spawnpoint will have the specified tags added to their ID card. You can, for example, use these tags to limit access to some parts of the sub.
infotexts.SpawnpointJobsTooltip: Only characters with the specified job will spawn at this spawnpoint.
infotexts.ReloadLinkedSubTooltip: Reload the linked submarine from the specified file
infotexts.LinkLinkedSub: Hold space to link to a docking port
infotexts.SpamFilterKicked: You have been kicked by the spam filter.
infotexts.SpamFilterBlocked: You have been blocked by the spam filter. Try again after 10 seconds.
infotexts.ReactorTipFissionRate: Increasing the fission rate makes the reactor consume more fuel and generate more heat. The heat is used to spin the turbine which generates electricity.
infotexts.ReactorTipTurbineOutput: The higher the turbine output, the more the reactor attempts to generate electricity. If the output is too high relative to the fission rate, the reactor will cool down, and if too low, it will overheat.
infotexts.ReactorTipTemperature: The temperature of the reactor core. The temperature is optimal when the bar is between the red indicators.
infotexts.ReactorTipLoad: How much power is currently being consumed by the devices connected to the reactor.
infotexts.ReactorTipPower: How much power is currently being generated by the reactor.
infotexts.ReactorTipAutoTemp: When automatic control is on, the reactor will automatically adjust itself according to the power consumption. However, the system is not fast enough to react to large fluctuations in power consumption, so manual adjustments may still be needed.
infotexts.SteeringAutoPilotMaintainPosTip: AUTOPILOT ON\nMaintaining position. Choose the position to maintain by clicking on the display.
infotexts.SteeringAutoPilotLocationTip: AUTOPILOT ON\nAutopilot is set to navigate towards [locationname].
infotexts.SonarTipActive: When active sonar is on, the transponders send out pings that reflect from nearby obstacles. The pings may also be heard by hostile creatures or enemy submarines.
infotexts.SonarTipPassive: In passive mode, the sonar only listens to sources of sound and sounds reflected from nearby obstacles without actively sending out pings.
infotexts.PowerTransferTipOvervoltage: When the electrical grid is supplied more power than what is being consumed, the voltage rises which may cause damage to electrical devices.
infotexts.PowerTransferTipLowvoltage: When there's not enough power available, the voltage drops which may cause some devices to shut down.
infotexts.PowerTransferTipLoad: How much power is currently being consumed by the devices connected to the electrical grid.
infotexts.PowerTransferTipPower: How much power is currently being supplied to the electrical grid.
infotexts.HealthItemUseTip: Drop items here to use them on the selected limb. You can also use items with the inventory hotkeys or by double clicking.
infotexts.LowMedicalSkillWarning: Low medical skill! The suitable treatment list may be inaccurate.
infotexts.HealthLimbName.Head: Head
infotexts.TraitorStartMessage: You are the Traitor! Your secret task is to assassinate [targetname]! Discretion is an utmost concern; sinking the submarine and killing the entire crew will arouse suspicion amongst the Fleet. If possible, make the death look like an accident.
infotexts.TraitorMoreAgentsMessage:
It is possible that there are other agents on this submarine. You don't know their names, but you do have a method of communication. Use the code words to greet the agent and code response to respond. Disguise such words in a normal-looking phrase so the crew doesn't suspect anything.

The code words are: [codewords].
The code response is: [coderesponse].
infotexts.TraitorStartMessageServer: [traitorname] is the traitor and the target is [targetname].
infotexts.TraitorEndMessageSuccess: [traitorname] was a traitor! [Genderpronounpossessive] task was to assassinate [targetname]. The task was successful.
infotexts.TraitorEndMessageSuccessTraitorDead: [traitorname] was a traitor! [Genderpronounpossessive] task was to assassinate [targetname]. The task was successful, but the traitor did not make it out alive either.
infotexts.TraitorEndMessageSuccessTraitorDetained: [traitorname] was a traitor! [Genderpronounpossessive] task was to assassinate [targetname]. The task was successful, but the traitor was succesfully detained.
infotexts.TraitorEndMessageFailure: [traitorname] was a traitor! [Genderpronounpossessive] task was to assassinate [targetname]. The task was unsuccessful.
infotexts.TraitorEndMessageFailureTraitorDead: [traitorname] was a traitor! [Genderpronounpossessive] task was to assassinate [targetname], but [genderpronoun] got [genderpronounreflexive] killed before completing it.
infotexts.TraitorEndMessageFailureTraitorDetained: [traitorname] was a traitor! [Genderpronounpossessive] task was to assassinate [targetname]. The task failed - [genderpronoun] was successfully detained.
infotexts.Self_CauseOfDeathDescription.Damage: You have succumbed to your injuries.
infotexts.Self_CauseOfDeathDescription.Pressure: You have been crushed by water pressure.
infotexts.Self_CauseOfDeathDescription.Husk: The parasite has taken over your body.
infotexts.Self_CauseOfDeathDescription.Disconnecte: You were disconnected from the server.
infotexts.GiveInHelpMultiplayer: Let go of your character and enter spectator mode (other players will no longer be able to revive you)
infotexts.GiveInHelpSingleplayer: The character can no longer be revived if you give in.
infotexts.DeathChatNotification: Your chat messages will only be visible to other dead players.
infotexts.DialogReactorFuel: Loading more fuel to the reactor!
infotexts.DialogReactorTaken: Hands off please, I've got this!
Hey, we don't need two people at the reactor!
infotexts.DialogCantFindController: I can't find a way to operate the [item]!
I don't know how to control the [item]!
infotexts.DialogNoBatteries: There aren't any batteries on this boat!
infotexts.DialogLeakFixed: Repairing [roomname], a few more holes to go!
infotexts.DialogGetDivingGear: Need to find a diving suit!
infotexts.DialogGetOxygenTank: Need to find an oxygen tank!
infotexts.DialogNoFire: I don't think there's any fire to put out!
infotexts.DialogSteeringTaken: Hey, I'm at the helm now!
Hands off please, I'm steering now!
Hey, we don't need two people to steer!
infotexts.DialogSonarTarget: A target on the sonar at [direction]!
A blip on the sonar at [direction]!
infotexts.DialogSonarTargetLarge: A large target on the sonar at [direction]!
Something big on the sonar at [direction]!
infotexts.OrderDialogSelf.operatereactor: I'll take care of the reactor!
infotexts.OrderDialog.steer.navigatetodestination: [name], set the course to our destination!
infotexts.OrderDialog.chargebatteries.charge: [name], make sure all batteries are charged!
infotexts.OrderDialog.rescue: [name], give medical aid to anyone in need!
infotexts.OrderDialogSelf.rescue: I'll give medical aid to anyone in need!
infotexts.OrderDialogSelf.repairsystems: I'll take care of broken devices!
infotexts.OrderDialogSelf.repairsystems.jobspecifi: I'll take care of broken devices!
infotexts.OrderDialog.repairsystems.all: [name], repair any damaged systems! I don't care if you don't have the skills, do your best!
[name], try to fix any broken devices, even if it's something you're not trained for!
[name], repair any damaged devices! Anything you can, I don't care about your training now!
infotexts.OrderDialogSelf.repairsystems.all: I'll take care of broken devices!
infotexts.OrderDialog.reportbrokendevices: Need someone to repair devices in [roomname]!
infotexts.HuskDormant: It feels as if something was stuck in your throat
infotexts.HuskCantSpeak: You feel something moving in your throat. You try to scream but no sound comes out.
infotexts.HuskActivate: A strange chitinous appendage bursts out from your mouth. Use it to inject eggs into a living body by pressing [Attack]!
infotexts.EntityDescription.Hull: Hulls determine which parts are considered to be "inside the sub". Generally every room should be enclosed by a hull.
infotexts.EntityDescription.gap: Gaps allow water and air to flow between two hulls.
infotexts.EntityDescription.waypoint: Used by AI characters to navigate inside the submarine.
infotexts.EntityDescription.spawnpoint: Determines which rooms the crew spawns inside.
infotexts.WelcomeText: "Welcome aboard 'captain'. We'll be plain with you: We don't think much of you, and we don't think you have what it takes to command this fine vessel or us, its crew, through these hellish waters. What does a child of privilege from the colonies with an inherited sub know of survival way out there in the dark and the cold? Regardless, it seems this is how things are going to be... for now, and we need to get you making decisions that at least won't get us all killed immediately, although that might be a small mercy... Listen well when we have something to say, or you'll be taking a swim with the gulper fishes, the waitawhile, the mantises and god knows what else, you hear?"
infotexts.DestinationObjectiveText: "Wonders will never cease! You managed to get us underway. You're still fresh meat, though 'captain', and we still need to make it to {0}... don't screw this up."
infotexts.Degrading1Text: "This vessel, she's a delicate thing and her systems tend to break down over time without maintenance! Any captain worth their salt would know this."
infotexts.Approach2Text: "Well now, looks like Captain Fresh Meat here has gained a little salt! You managed to get us to where we were going, but don't let that go to your head, you're still way out of your depth here, but maybe you can learn... maybe we do stand a chance."
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.InternalDamage: The area is an ugly shade of purple, and apparently very painful to touch. You suspect a bone might be broken.
infotexts.AfflictionCauseOfDeathSelf.InternalDamag: You have succumbed to your internal injuries.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.Bleeding: Blood pours freely from this ragged and particularly nasty open wound.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.Burn: The area is blistered and red, and skin is already beginning to peel away in sheets. The patient is in a great deal of pain.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.OxygenLow: The skin is pale and clammy, and the lips turning blue.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.Bloodloss: The patient is pale and cold. Their heart beats in an alarmingly rapid fashion.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.Stun: The patient is dazed and unresponsive.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.Pressure: There is obvious massive organ damage and the blood vessels of the eye have burst, creating an unnerving red gaze.
infotexts.AfflictionCauseOfDeathSelf.Pressure: You have been crushed by water pressure.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.HuskInfection: Something dark and unpleasant moves in the mouth. They are rendered completely mute, save for occasional clicking sounds apparently emanating from deep within the throat.
infotexts.AfflictionCauseOfDeath.HuskInfection: Taken over by a husk parasite.
infotexts.AfflictionCauseOfDeathSelf.HuskInfection: You have been taken over by the husk parasite.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.Psychosis: The patient rants and mutters in an agitated fashion, a steady commentary of unseen events.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.Drunk: The smell of alcohol rises from them like a vapor, their speech slurs a little, and their eyes fail to focus.
infotexts.AfflictionCauseOfDeathSelf.Drunk: You have died of alcohol poisoning.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.OpiateWithdrawal: Agitation and a tremor are obvious, as are the signs of nausea.
infotexts.AfflictionCauseOfDeathSelf.OpiateWithdra: You have died of opiate withdrawal.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.OpiateOverdose: The patient has pinpoint pupils and icy cold skin. They struggle to breathe and swallow.
infotexts.AfflictionCauseOfDeathSelf.OpiateOverdos: You have died of opiate overdose.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.OpiateAddiction: The patient is happy enough... so long as they get what they need.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.GunshotWound: The entry site is a small, dark, bruised hole oozing a little blood. The exit wound however is a large ragged mess of exposed tissue and pouring blood.
infotexts.AfflictionCauseOfDeathSelf.GunshotWound: You have died of gunshot wounds.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.MorbusinePoisoning: The patient can't breathe at all, and their heartrate is slowing rapidly.
infotexts.AfflictionCauseOfDeathSelf.MorbusinePois: You have died of morbusine poisoning.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.SufforinPoisoning: Without prompt treatment, sufforine poisoning leads to delusions and rapid death.
infotexts.AfflictionCauseOfDeathSelf.SufforinPoiso: You have died of sufforin poisoning.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.CyanidePoisoning: The patient is confused and has trouble breathing. Their skin is reddish and they have occasional muscle spasms.
infotexts.AfflictionCauseOfDeathSelf.CyanidePoison: You have died of cyanide poisoning.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.Haste: Movement speed and reflexes are heightened.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.HuskInfectionResis: Patient's immune system is more attuned to alien parasites.
infotexts.AfflictionDescription.PressureResistance: Internal organs are more accustomed to high pressures.
infotexts.EntityDescription.captainscap: A token of the Captain's unquestionable authority.
infotexts.EntityDescription.healthscanner: A heads-up display that displays information of the vital signs and status of nearby humans.
infotexts.EntityDescription.orangejumpsuit: The fire-resistant fabric offers some protection against fires.
infotexts.EntityDescription.bluejumpsuit: The fire-resistant fabric offers some protection against fires.
infotexts.EntityDescription.headset: Allows remote communication between the crew.
infotexts.EntityDescription.bodyarmor: While the body armor won't offer adequate protection against most of the inhabitants of the subsurface ocean, it can be extremely useful if there are traitors on board.
infotexts.EntityDescription.ballistichelmet: While the helmet won't offer adequate protection against most of the inhabitants of the subsurface ocean, it can be extremely useful if there are traitors on board.
infotexts.EntityDescription.alienblood: Blood extracted from an Europan lifeform. Can be further processed into a blood substitute for the treatment of blood loss.
infotexts.EntityDescription.huskeggs: Dormant eggs of the Europan lifeform colloquially referred to as 'husk parasite'.
infotexts.EntityDescription.swimbladder: Many Europan lifeforms have a swim bladder containing tissue fluids that can be easily processed into stabilozine and saline.
infotexts.EntityDescription.adrenalinegland: Contains large amounts of adrenaline, which can be extracted using a deconstructor.
infotexts.EntityDescription.divingmask: Small enough to carry around in case of need, but won't protect you from the water pressure in the event of a full-blown hull breach.
infotexts.EntityDescription.divingsuit: An atmospheric diving suit capable of withstanding the immense pressure under Europa's crust.
infotexts.EntityDescription.door: A pre-wired door with two buttons.
infotexts.EntityDescription.junctionbox: Serves as a hub for power distribution and relaying signals between devices.
infotexts.EntityDescription.battery: Generally used for storing backup power in case of a reactor failure.
infotexts.EntityDescription.shuttlebattery: Generally used for storing backup power in case of a reactor failure.
infotexts.EntityDescription.supercapacitor: Can deliver charge much faster than batteries.
infotexts.EntityDescription.batterycell: Used as a power source for various handheld devices. Most submarines have several stationary backup batteries with recharge docks for battery cells.
infotexts.EntityDescription.fulguriumbatterycell: A battery cell constructed of the rare and poorly understood compound Fulgurium.
infotexts.EntityDescription.chargingdock: A wall-mounted battery cell charging dock.
infotexts.EntityDescription.fpgacircuit: Field-programmable gate array - a multi-purpose circuit which can be reconfigured for use in a large variety of electrical devices.
infotexts.EntityDescription.andcomponent: Sends a signal when both inputs receive a signal within a set period of each other.
infotexts.EntityDescription.addercomponent: Outputs the sum of the received signals.
infotexts.EntityDescription.orcomponent: Sends a signal if either of the inputs receive a signal.
infotexts.EntityDescription.notcomponent: Sends a signal when the input is NOT receiving a signal.
infotexts.EntityDescription.relaycomponent: When switched on, forwards all received signals from the input connections to the outputs.
infotexts.EntityDescription.delaycomponent: Delays all received signals for a specific amount of time.
infotexts.EntityDescription.oxygendetector: Sends out a value between 0-100 depending on the quality of the surrounding air.
infotexts.EntityDescription.waterdetector: Sends out a signal when the detector is submerged.
infotexts.EntityDescription.smokedetector: Sends out a signal when it senses smoke.
infotexts.EntityDescription.motiondetector: Sends out a signal when it detects movement.
infotexts.EntityDescription.signalcheckcomponent: Sends a signal when a signal matching a specific value is received.
infotexts.EntityDescription.regexcomponent: Sends a signal if the received signal matches a specific regular expression pattern.
infotexts.EntityDescription.oscillator: Sends out a periodic, oscillating signal.
infotexts.EntityDescription.wificomponent: Allows remote communication between other Wifi Components that are using the same channel.
infotexts.EntityDescription.camera: Typically used in photonics masts to provide the crew with a high-resolution view of the area outside the sub.
infotexts.EntityDescription.fabricator: A machine capable of manufacturing a wide range of items out of basic raw materials.
infotexts.EntityDescription.medicalfabricator: A machine that can be used to manufacture various medicines.
infotexts.EntityDescription.deconstructor: Disassembles and breaks down items to reusable components and material bars.
infotexts.EntityDescription.carbon: Most commonly used in the manufacture of steel and plastic.
infotexts.EntityDescription.iron: Can be used in the manufacture of simple tools, or refined into steel by mixing it with carbon.
infotexts.EntityDescription.tin: Most commonly used in the manufacture of various electrical components.
infotexts.EntityDescription.lead: Most commonly used in the manufacture of various types of ammunition.
infotexts.EntityDescription.phosphorus: Used in the manufacture of lamps, explosives and some medical compounds.
infotexts.EntityDescription.copper: Most commonly used in the manufacture of electrical wiring.
infotexts.EntityDescription.zinc: Most commonly used in the manufacture of batteries and tonic liquid.
infotexts.EntityDescription.sodium: Medical fabricators can combine sodium and chloride to create a saline solution, which can be used as a treatment for blood loss or as an ingredient for more complex medicine.
infotexts.EntityDescription.silicon: Used as an ingredient in aluminium alloys, plastic and various electrical components.
infotexts.EntityDescription.uranium: Can be refined in a fabricator to create fuel rods for a nuclear reactor, or used in the manufacture of nuclear weapons.
infotexts.EntityDescription.potassium: Used in the manufacture of explosives and medical compounds. Reacts violently when in contact with water.
infotexts.EntityDescription.magnesium: Used in the manufacture of explosives and medical compounds. Reacts violently when in contact with water.
infotexts.EntityDescription.lithium: Most commonly used in the manufacture of batteries and antipsychotic drugs.
infotexts.EntityDescription.chlorine: Most commonly used saline, a common treatment for blood loss, and chloral hydrate, a powerful sedative.
infotexts.EntityDescription.slimebacteria: A colony of myxobacteria. Can be processed into antibiotics.
infotexts.EntityDescription.titanite: A mineral containing titanium and iron.
infotexts.EntityDescription.brockite: A mineral containing titanium and phosphorus.
infotexts.EntityDescription.amblygonite: A mineral composed of lithium, aluminium and sodium.
infotexts.EntityDescription.sphalerite: A mineral consisting largely of zinc in crystalline form.
infotexts.EntityDescription.quartz: A crystalline mineral composed of silicon.
infotexts.EntityDescription.diamond: A crystal composed of solid carbon.
infotexts.EntityDescription.hydroxyapatite: A mineral composed of calcium and phosphorus.
infotexts.EntityDescription.uraniumore: A mineral containing large concentrations of uranium.
infotexts.EntityDescription.stannite: A mineral composed of copper, iron and tin.
infotexts.EntityDescription.esperite: A mineral composed of zinc and lead.
infotexts.EntityDescription.galena: A mineral mostly consisting of lead.
infotexts.EntityDescription.langbeinite: A mineral consisting of potassium and magnesium.
infotexts.EntityDescription.chamosite: A mineral consisting of iron and aluminium.
infotexts.EntityDescription.ironore: A mineral containing large amounts of iron.
infotexts.EntityDescription.polyhalite: A mineral consisting of potassium and calcium.
infotexts.EntityDescription.sylvite: A mineral containing potassium and sodium.
infotexts.EntityDescription.lazulite: A mineral containing phosphorus and iron.
infotexts.EntityDescription.opium: A relatively mild opioid obtained from Aquatic Poppy. Most commonly used to manufacture morphine and fentanyl.
infotexts.EntityDescription.antibiotics: A mild antibiotic that acts against a wide range of disease-causing bacteria, though with side effect of internal damage. Used as an ingredient in many medical compounds.
infotexts.EntityDescription.stabilozine: Used as an ingredient in the manufacture of various medicines. On its own, can be mildly useful in the treatment of internal damage and burns, and slightly more effectively for oxygen deprivation.
infotexts.EntityDescription.ethanol: Medical alcohol used as an ingredient in the manufacture of various medicines. Drinking while on duty is not advised.
infotexts.EntityDescription.sulphuricacid: A strong acid that causes burns when in contact with skin. Used as an ingredient in several poisons.
infotexts.EntityDescription.antibleeding1: Basic bandages, useful in the treatment of bleeding wounds and burns.
infotexts.EntityDescription.antibleeding2: A synthetic skin with hemostatic properties, able to quickly seal most wounds.
infotexts.EntityDescription.antibleeding3: An antibiotic glue with hemostatic properties. Seals bleeding wounds almost immediately and treats burns very effectively. Use with care as it may cause mobile clots in the bloodstream.
infotexts.EntityDescription.antidama1: A powerful opiate for treating pain associated with internal injuries, but will cause shortness of breath and eventual dependency with overuse.
infotexts.EntityDescription.antidama2: A powerful opiate for treating pain associated with internal injuries, but will cause shortness of breath and eventual dependency with overuse.
infotexts.EntityDescription.antibloodloss1: A sodium chloride infusion mildly useful in the treatment of blood loss.
infotexts.EntityDescription.antibloodloss2: A pack of blood substitute for the treatment of blood loss.
infotexts.EntityDescription.deusizine: A highly potent stimulant effective in the treatment of internal damage, oxygen deprivation and to a lesser extent, blood loss. Produces mild burns as a side effect.
infotexts.EntityDescription.calyxanide: An antiparasitic drug used in the treatment of husk parasite infections. Might require higher dosage to cure the infection at later stages.
infotexts.EntityDescription.antinarc: An opioid antagonist for the treatment of opiate based withdrawal and overdose.
infotexts.EntityDescription.morbusineantidote: An antidote for acute morbusine poisoning.
infotexts.EntityDescription.liquidoxygenite: A mildy toxic solution that slowly releases oxygen into the bloodstream when injected. Avoid dropping.
infotexts.EntityDescription.tonicliquid: A medical solution that's mildy effective as a treatment for internal damage, but most commonly used as an ingredient in more complex medical compounds.
infotexts.EntityDescription.steroids: Temporarily increases muscular strength and physical performance.
infotexts.EntityDescription.hyperzine: An extremely potent muscle stimulant for those moments when you gotta go fast.
infotexts.EntityDescription.chloralhydrate: A sedative that can be used to knock someone out for a short period of time.
infotexts.EntityDescription.weldingtool: One of the most crucial tools on board the submarine. Also works underwater.
infotexts.EntityDescription.plasmacutter: Cuts through various materials using a jet of ionized oxygen.
infotexts.EntityDescription.coilgun: A rapid-firing turret that propels metal bolts using electromagnets. Generally not very effective against large or heavily armored targets, but ideal for taking down smaller enemies.
infotexts.EntityDescription.uex: A simple explosive compound made of sodium and phosphorus.
infotexts.EntityDescription.ic4block: A compound made of C-4 and incendium.
infotexts.EntityDescription.detonator: A device that detonates any contained explosive when receiving a signal.
infotexts.EntityDescription.nitroglycerin: A highly unstable liquid that may explode when subjected to heat or physical shock.
infotexts.EntityDescription.railgun: A heavy turret that uses electromagnetic force to launch shells at very high velocities. Requires very large surges of power (usually supplied by supercapacitors) and has a low rate of fire, and as such it's most often used against large and heavily armored targets.
infotexts.EntityDescription.periscope: A device that can be used to observe the outside of the sub by connecting it to a camera, or to control weapons such as the railgun and coilgun.
infotexts.EntityDescription.stunbaton: If verbal orders are insufficient, a high-voltage shock from a Stun Baton may be enough to beat an unruly crew member into submission.
infotexts.EntityDescription.automateddockinghatch: A docking hatch with a circuit that automatically opens the hatch when docked, and closes the hatch when undocking (with a delay that prevents deattaching while the hatch is still closing)
infotexts.EntityDescription.automaticdoor: A door that closes automatically after 5 seconds if there's no-one in the doorway.
infotexts.EntityDescription.automatichatch: A hatch that closes automatically in 5 seconds if there's no-one in the way.
infotexts.EntityDescription.automaticwindoweddoor: A door that closes automatically after 5 seconds if there's no-one in the doorway.
infotexts.EntityDescription.divingsuitlocker: A diving suit locker with one dive-ready suit.
infotexts.EntityDescription.door: A pre-wired door with two buttons.
infotexts.EntityDescription.largedivinggearcabinet: A cabinet loaded with diving masks, oxygen tanks, underwater scooters, handheld sonars and flares.
infotexts.EntityDescription.largedivingsuitcabinet: A cabinet with 5 dive-ready diving suits and 10 oxygen tanks.
infotexts.EntityDescription.smalldivinggearcabinet: A cabinet with diving masks, underwater scooters and handheld sonars
infotexts.JobDescription.captain: The Commanding Officer is responsible for commanding the entirety of the crew and ensuring that everything is running smoothly.
infotexts.JobDescription.engineer: Engineers are the backbone of a submarine's crew, complementing a mechanic's Mechanical Engineering skill with their knowledge of electrical engineering. They are capable of performing maintenance on the various electrical pieces of the submarine.
infotexts.JobDescription.mechanic: Mechanics are capable of fixing various mechanical devices with their high Mechanical Engineering skill. Together with engineers they ensure a submarine is working to its fullest.
infotexts.JobDescription.securityofficer: Security Officers are responsible for keeping the submarine safe from threats, both external and internal. The creatures inhabiting the ocean aren't the only threat they need to worry about, as several of the renegade groups opposing the Europa Coalition are known to have sent infiltrators on board the vessels.
infotexts.JobDescription.medicaldoctor: Although usually taken for granted, Doctors play an important role on the submarine, possessing the required skill to treat injured or unconscious crew members. Their skills can also be useful for creating various non-medicinal chemicals.
infotexts.JobDescription.assistant: Assistants don't have any specific responsibilities or areas of expertise. This job is a good choice for newcomers who want to get a hang of working on board the submarine without taking up tasks that they aren't qualified for.
infotexts.LocationChange.None.ChangeTo.Outpost: A new outpost has been established at [previousname].
infotexts.LocationChange.None.ChangeTo.Military: A new military outpost has been established at [previousname].
infotexts.LocationChange.None.ChangeTo.Research: A new research outpost has been established at [previousname].
infotexts.LocationChange.Ruins.ChangeTo.Outpost: An outpost has been established at [previousname].
infotexts.LocationChange.Ruins.ChangeTo.Military: A military outpost has been established at [previousname].
infotexts.LocationChange.Ruins.ChangeTo.Research: A research outpost has been established at [previousname].
